abstract: Ten major companies, including industrial giants like General Electric, DuPont and Alcoa, have banded together with leading environmental groups to call for a firm nationwide limit on carbon dioxide emissions that would lead to reductions of 10 to 30 percent over the next 15 years. Besides adding pressure on Congress to act, one of the group’s major goals is the creation of a market in which allowances to emit carbon dioxide could be traded in a way that achieves the greatest reduction at the lowest cost.
lead_paragraph: Ten major companies, including industrial giants like General Electric, DuPont and Alcoa, have banded together with leading environmental groups to call for a firm nationwide limit on carbon dioxide emissions that would lead to reductions of 10 to 30 percent over the next 15 years. Besides adding pressure on Congress to act, one of the group’s major goals is the creation of a market in which allowances to emit carbon dioxide could be traded in a way that achieves the greatest reduction at the lowest cost.

headline.main: Firms Band Together for Emissions Market
